title: Linear Programming for Maximum Independent Set
summary: Maximum independent set, or "maximum stable" set is one of classical NP-complete problems described in Richard Karp's 1972 paper "Reducibility Among Combinatorial Problems". Other NP-complete problems often have a simple reduction to it, for instance, p.3 of Tony Jebara's "MAP Estimation, Message Passing, and Perfect Graphs" shows how MAP inference in an arbitrary MRF reduces to Maximum Weight
